William Osier, Bart., passed away

be felt not only by members of the
medical profession both in England and this country, but also by
many others who have come in
contact with his magnetic personality.
His death is attributed directly
to the railroad strike in England.
When returning to Oxford from
Glasgow his train was held up by
the strike shortly after passing
through Edinburg, and he was
forced to complete his journey by
automobile. During this trip he
contracted a cold which later led
to pneumonia. He was recovering front this attack—in fact, he
was so much improved as to send
Christmas greetings to several of
his former colleagues at the Hospital, saying that he was putting
up a good fight—when he Innj an
unexpected relapse, and his death
followed directly from a hemorrhage.

Before a large audience in Albaugh's Theater, on the evening
of December 22, the Johns Hopkins Dramatic Club presented Sir
.Tames Barrie's comedy,"The Admirable Crichton." The performance, like that of Bernard Shaw's
"You Never Can Tell," given last
season, was under the direction of
Miss Clementine Walter. The
scenes were painted for the occasion by Mr. Carol Sax, with the
assistance of members of the club,
and all the appointments essential
to a finished production were provided with painstaking care.
The play was happily chosen.
We do not see enough of Barrie;
and all Baltimoreans who know.
that a moving-picture show has
nothing in the world to do with
the drama-should be grateful to
the club for an opportunity to see
another Barrie play carefully
done. In "The Admirable Crich.ton" we have, not the tenderly
whimsical moralist of "A Kiss for
Cinderella" and "Dear Brutus,"
but a satirical Barrie, who sets before us the problem of master and
servant — in England and on a
South Pacific Island. He creates
a very human butler, who in England worships the system of caste
that obtains in a well-ordered
Mayfair residence, but who on an
island rises naturally to the leadership for which Ile is fitted. The
return to nature works so complete a revolution in two years
that when he falls in love with
his former mistress he is helped
to a decision to woo her by two
haunting lines from Henley—
I was a king in Babylon
And you were a Christian slave,
lines which, by the way, have furnished the impulse for a novel by
Burton E. Stevenson. But just as
the "Admirable Crichton" has
been accepted. and even royalty
seems within b - grasp, caste returns to him in the form of a
British ship, summoned by his
deliberate act; the semi-royal
robe .falls froip his shoulders, the
phrase "My Lady!" conies to his
lips, and Crichton is a butler
again.
Although competition was open
to the whole college, the leading
parts fell to .the men who had
played successfully last year.

Now that the New Year has
come and the exams are drawing
near, old Hopkins men feel that
there is something lacking about
the University to make the season
complete. Men who have pondered over this lack of _something
have realized that the empty space
left in college activity should be
and soon will be filled in by those
students who pride themselves
upon their oratorical powers or
their persuasive eloquence.
The Debating Council has been
busy all fall arranging with other
colleges for the annual intercollegiates and the various oratorical
contests that Will be held in the
early months of 1920. If the traditional triangle contest with Virginia and North Carolina is held,
and* in all probability it will, the
two Hopkins Varsity teams will
travel down to the sunny South
and meet their old rivals on foreign grounds—at Charlottesville
and Chapel Hill. This will be a
departure from last year's program, in which our affirmative
team stayed home to defend
Homewood from the aggressions
of the North Carolinians, while
our negative team assumed the offensive and carried the war into
territory of the Virginians. The
change to the present system was
instigated by a desire on the part
of all contestants to insure impartial judging.
In the past, Hopkins has been
more successful than either of the
other institutions, with North Carolina a close second. Last year
Virginia came out victorious with
Hopkins second, while North
Carolina was forced to yield both
the affirmative and the negative
contests. This year, Hopkin
must assume her old place at the
head of the list. This can only
be done by making the teams,
through competition and hard
work, the best that the University
can produce. Places on the team
are open to all members of the
University, graduate or undergraduate, and it is the desire of
the Debating Council that these
places be hotly contested. The
tryouts and the subject will be
announced within a week or so
if an agreement can be reached
with Virginia and North Carolina.
In the meantime, the freshmen are
busily at work preparing for the
24th of January, when they will
start the debating ball rolling by
staging their annual contest with
the sophomores. Those not actually engaged in this contest should
bear the date in mind and by theil
presence lend their support to the
contestants. The two lower classes, at least, should be out in force
to yell their representives on to
victory.

Now that the New Year has
come and the exams are drawing
near, old Hopkins men feel that
there is something lacking about
the University to make the season
complete. Men who have pondered over this lack of _something

The Debating Council has been
busy all fall arranging with other
colleges for the annual intercollegiates and the various oratorical
contests that Will be held in the
early months of 1920. If the traditional triangle contest with Virginia and North Carolina is held,

two Hopkins Varsity teams will

change to the present system was
instigated by a desire on the part

more successful than either of the
other institutions, with North Carolina a close second. Last year

Hopkins second, while North
Carolina was forced to yield both
the affirmative and the negative
contests. This year, Hopkin
must assume her old place at the
head of the list. This can only

through competition and hard
work, the best that the University
can produce. Places on the team

University, graduate or undergraduate, and it is the desire of
the Debating Council that these
places be hotly contested. The
tryouts and the subject will be
announced within a week or so
if an agreement can be reached
with Virginia and North Carolina.

busily at work preparing for the
24th of January, when they will
start the debating ball rolling by
staging their annual contest with

bear the date in mind and by theil
presence lend their support to the
contestants. The two lower classes, at least, should be out in force

victory.
